input_text:
Job Title: Process Engineer

Location: LaGrange, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Product Management, Research

Description:
Working at Freudenberg: "We will wow your world!" This is our promise. As a global technology group, we not only make the world cleaner, healthier and more comfortable, but also offer our 51,000 employees a networked and diverse environment where everyone can thrive individually. Be surprised and experience your own wow moments.

We at Freudenberg-NOK Sealing Technologies run the business operations of Freudenberg Sealing Technologies (FST) in the Americas. Being part of the global Freudenberg Group, our company is a leading producer of advanced sealing technologies for automotive and general industries. Freudenberg-NOK Sealing Technologies is a joint venture between Freudenberg and NOK Corp. in Japan, is headquartered in Plymouth, MI, operates more than 20 facilities and employs about 4,700 people across the Americas.

Some of your Benefits 

401K Match: Save for retirement with the company's help.

Health Insurance: Rely on comprehensive services whenever you need it.

Diversity & Inclusion: We focus on providing an inclusive environment and recognize our diversity contributes to our success.

Paid Holidays: With paid-time off, local holidays are all the way more relaxing.

Vacation: We offer time off to refresh and recharge.

 LaGrange, GA

On-Site

 Freudenberg-NOK General Partnership

You support our team as

 Process Engineer 

Responsibilities 

Maintains and improves process capabilities using appropriate tools and applicable methodologies.Inputs and analyses numerical data to identify patterns and relationships that can be used to develop optimal workflows and processes.Reviews Key Performance Indicator (KPI) monitoring systems and uses technology to achieve goals.Supports the creation of training documents and delivers training.Mentors Apprentices and Technicians to increase individual and team understanding and capability.Manages new product launches focusing on process & tooling design & development to meet customer requirements and expectations, along with FNST profitability requirements, including productivity and scrap targets.Assesses the feasibility of new production compounds concentrating on their capability of performing to the customer specification and their ease of manufacturing. Recommends changes be made to the formulation of the compound when the compound does not perform as expected.Assists with developing the most economical way to manufacture the pre-forms using existing or new technologies.Maintains the preproduction study system and takes quality system compliance responsibility for the area.Designs, coordinates, and performs pre-production studies for new materials and/or processes.Assists in mold design for prototype area as needed.Coordinates preproduction efforts of Material development, Rubber mixing, and Molding departments.Resolves potential processing problems uncovered during preproduction study.Completes preproduction studies in a timely manner in coordination with customer timing or other project manager’s requirements.Supports and possibly manages capital projects – New equipment installation and testing.

Qualifications 

Bachelor of Science in Engineering.1 or more years of experience in manufacturing.2 or more years of experience with injection and/or compression rubber molding preferred.2 or more years of experience with rubber compounding a plus.Knowledge of manufacturing process, PLC controls, hydraulics, pneumatics and user knowledge of personal computersAbility to measure cycle time, modify machine functions to meet specific item requirements, develop new machine process functions, troubleshoot and countermeasure both machinery and process problems and apply the Kaizen / Six Sigma mindset to the production process.Good verbal and written communication skills

The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Process Engineer
output_json.summary: Supports team as Process Engineer focusing on process improvement, KPI monitoring, training, and new product launches.
job_responsibilities: Maintains and improves process capabilities using tools and methodologies.
Inputs and analyzes numerical data to identify patterns and relationships.
Reviews KPI monitoring systems and achieves goals using technology.
Supports creation of training documents and delivers training.
Manages new product launches focusing on process & tooling design & development.
Assesses feasibility of new production compounds.
Coordinates efforts of Material development, Rubber mixing, and Molding departments.
Completes pre-production studies in a timely manner.
output_json.company_information: Freudenberg-NOK Sealing Technologies is a joint venture between Freudenberg and NOK Corp., headquartered in Plymouth, MI, with over 20 facilities and approximately 4,700 employees across the Americas.

Freudenberg-NOK Sealing Technologies is a joint venture between Freudenberg and NOK Corp., headquartered in Plymouth, MI, with over 20 facilities and approximately 4,700 employees across the Americas.
Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.
